section.title: Index of Paradigm Lexemes: Tsamakko
section.para:
The following lexical items are used in the verbal paradigms:

Lemma Gloss LexProperties Note

dig conjClass:conjB,pos:verb
žíʔ
eat conjClass:conjB,pos:verb
kaʔ-is-

q’abaʔ -
hear conjClass:conjA,pos:verb
ʕug
drink conjClass:conjA,pos:verb
žoq’-am-
be beaten conjClass:conjB,pos:verb
ʔabun-
rock conjClass:conjB,pos:verb

section.title: Index of Morphosyntactic Properties: Tsamakko
section.para: Tsamakko paradigms employ the following property-value dimensions

listitem.para: Tsamakko follows the Cushitic-Omotic PNG Pattern.

Inflection Class: [In most inflectional languages, phonological and grammaticization processes conspire to create more or less marked morphophonemic differences in the verbal inflections of different sets of verbs.]

section.title: Index of Archive Paradigms: Tsamakko
section.para: The following tabel lists the shared property:value pairs for each paradigm, and then the variable property=value-list (comma separated). The abbreviation "PNG" in the paradigm variable-value lists stands for: gender:f,m,⊤ number:pl,sg person:p1,p2,p3 I.e., the PNG combinations normal with finite tam-forms.Clicking on the paradigmLabel will yield a display of the paradigm in question [either by link to hard-coded term cluster, or canned SPARQL query].

td.literallayout: causative1 causative2 generic inceptive middle normal o-assim passive verbaliser
aorist consecutive future imperfect jussive past
